intro: Tripogon anantaswamianus, commonly known as the Anantaswamianus grass, is a flowering plant species native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands and marshy areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
